case_vignette: A 35-year-old African American female presents for evaluation of a painless tongue growth present for the past three months! She denies biting the site or any inciting trauma! She noted it when brushing her teeth and it has slowly grown in size! Physical examination reveals a pink nodule on the right mid-tongue! An excisional biopsy is performed and reveals pseudoepitheliomatous hyperplasia and collections of large polygonal cells with abundant cytoplasm and small cytoplasmic inclusions in the dermis!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a painless growth on my tongue that I noticed about three months ago.
Has the growth changed in size or appearance since you first noticed it?
Yes, it has slowly grown in size since I first noticed it.
Do you have any other symptoms like difficulty swallowing, speaking, or changes in taste?
No, I don't have any other symptoms like difficulty swallowing, speaking, or changes in taste.
Do you have any history of smoking or using tobacco products?
No, I don't use tobacco products or smoke.
Has anyone in your family had similar issues or been diagnosed with oral or other cancers?
No, no one in my family has had similar issues or been diagnosed with oral or other cancers.
Do you have any other medical conditions or are you currently on any medications?
No, I don't have any other medical conditions and I'm not on any medications.
Final Diagnosis: Oral fibroma
